title.narrative: RESOURCE MOBILISATION FOR SWAP

description.narrative: Effective mechanisms and strategies to strengthen resource mobilization and the harmonized approach (SWAP) for effective and efficient delivery of Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services to underserved areas are in place by 2016, which contributes to Sanitation, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres, Wash â€“ General, Water, Water Supply. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: At least 85% of women and children access improved water supply facilities and 60% of households use improved sanitation and hygiene services, with a focus on vulnerable and disadvantaged communities, by end of 2016

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF GENDER CHILDREN AND SOCIAL WELFARE

description.narrative: Water supply and Sanitation policy, planning and administration

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Effective mechanisms and strategies to strengthen resource mobilization and the harmonized approach (SWAP) for effective andefficient delivery of WASH services to underserved areas are in place by 2016

description.narrative: Resources for regular and emergency WASH activities were raised from various local and external sources. The enabling environment for WASH programme implementation improved through the development of the National Sanitation and Hygiene Strategy coordination. As way forward, the WASH programme will focus on bankable projects addressing the resilience agenda. | Status:Met | As-of Date:17/12/2018
